2. Iterate through each row of data in the table. For each row, find the value corresponding to the "high assists" column.
3. Compare the values found in step 2 across all rows. If a player has the highest number of assists in more games than any other player, then that player leads the team in assists for the most games.
4. In this table, we see that 'fernandez' has 7 assists in one game (row index 0), 10 assists in another game (row index 2), and 3 assists in yet another game (row index 4). 'Allen', on the other hand, has 7 assists (in row index 0), 11 assists (in row index 3), and 6 assists (in row index 5) across different games.
5. Since 'Fernandez' had 7 assists in one game where 'Allen' didn't have any, Fernandez leads the team in assists for more games than Allen.
